# The `MemoryDef` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Represents a read-write access to memory, whether it is a must-alias, or a may-alias. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MemoryDef</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Represents a read-write access to memory, whether it is a must-alias, or a may-alias.

In particular, the set of Instructions that will be represented by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a>&#39;s is exactly the set of Instructions for which <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaresults/#a2205e49ace8bb2fd9934342ff6a25e13">AliasAnalysis::getModRefInfo</a> returns &quot;Mod&quot; or &quot;ModRef&quot;. Note that, in order to provide def-def chains, all defs also have a use associated with them. This use points to the nearest reaching MemoryDef/MemoryPhi.

Definition at line 370 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h">MemorySSA.h</a>.
